line.name: ACE
line.text:
Service Change  Posted: 12/04/2012  4:32PM

Until further notice:

[A] No trains between Howard Beach-JFK/Broad Channel and the Rockaways.

[A] Service operates between 207 St and Lefferts Blvd/Howard Beach.

Free shuttle trains and shuttle buses provide alternate service.

Free shuttle buses operate nonstop between Howard Beach [A] and Mott Av.

Free shuttle trains operate between Mott Av and Beach 90 St. 

Shuttle hours of operation:

Departing Mott Av: 4am to 12 midnight, every 15 minutes.

Departing Beach 90 St: 4:30am to 12:30am, every 15 minutes.

Note:

Transfer between [A] trains and shuttle buses at Howard Beach.

Transfer between shuttle buses and shuttle trains at Mott Av.

line.name: NQR
line.text:
Service Change  Posted: 12/04/2012  3:51PM

[R] train service operates in two sections all times until further notice:

1. Between Forest Hills-71 Av and Whitehall St ( Days & Evenings)

2. Between Jay St-Metrotech and Bay Ridge-95 St

For service between Manhattan and Brooklyn take the [N] or [Q].

Transfer between [R] and [N] [Q] trains at Canal St or Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr.

For service between lower Manhattan and Brooklyn, use nearby [4] [5] stations instead.

Transfer between [R] and [4] [5] trains at Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr.

Reminder: On weekends, [5] service does not operate in Brooklyn.

line.name: B1 - B83
line.text:
Delays  Posted: 12/04/2012  3:51PM

B62 buses detoured due to FDNY activity.

Northbound: via Wythe Av, left on Clymer Av, right on Ross St, left on Bedford Av, right on Division Av and regular route.

Buses will make corresponding stops.

line.name: BX1 - BX55
line.text:
Planned Detour

All times

and Benson Avs.

Northbound/Southbound: Customers are advised to board
on Lane Av at Benson Av.

• Please allow additional travel time.




Planned Detour

All times

Buses are bypassing the Gun Hill Rd at Bronxwood Av bus stop.

Eastbound/Westbound: Customers are advised to use the
temporary bus stop on Gun Hill Rd at Colden Av.

• Please allow additional travel time.

M5, M5LTD and M7: Customers are advised to
use the bus stop on 47 St for limited service and
51 St for local service.

• Please allow additional travel time.

All times

North End Av and Broadway.

Eastbound:
Buses will make stops along Warren St between North
End Av and West St.

On Warren St between Broadway and Church St at
corresponding locations.

• Please allow additional travel time.

All Times

Temporary bus stop change due to construction.

M22 Westbound: Buses will bypass stops on Chambers
St at Church St and West Broadway.

M20 Southbound: Buses will bypass the Chambers St at
West Broadway stop.

Buses will make stops on West Broadway between Reade and
Chambers Sts.

• Please allow additional travel time.

St for local service.

• Please allow additional travel time.

line.name: Q1 - Q113
line.text:
Service Change  Posted: 12/04/2012  3:52PM

Q65 bus detoured due to sewer work on 45 Av at 158 St.

Detour as follows:

Northbound towards 110 St, 14 Av/College Point Blvd: Via 46 Av, right on 149 St, left on 45 Av and then regular route. 

Southbound towards Jamaica:  Via 45 Av, right on 149 St, left on 46 Av and then regular route. 

Corresponding bus stops will be made on 46 Av  in the Q26/27 bus stops. 

Please allow additional travel time. 



Service Change  Posted: 12/04/2012  3:45PM

Q65 bus service detoured due to DEP working on 14 Rd at 113 St. 

Detours are as follows:

North-bound: via College Point Blvd, left on 14 Av to regular route.

All corrseponding stops will be made along the detoured route.



Planned Detour
M1, M1LTD, M4, M4LTD and Q32 bus stop change due to Holiday Events

All times until Saturday, Jan 5, 2013

Buses will not stop on 5 or 6 Avs at 49 or 50 Sts.

M1, M1LTD, M4, M4LTD and Q32: Customers are
advised to use the bus stop on 52 St for limited service
and 46 St for local service.

• Please allow additional travel time.

line.name: Brooklyn-Battery
line.text: Starting on Monday, November 19th, at 6 a.m. both tubes will be opened for traffic in both directions around the clock. TRUCKS ARE STILL BANNED UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE.

line.name: Robert F. Kennedy
line.text: RFK REPORTS A DISABLED 5 AXLE TRUCK ON BOUND FROM QUEENS ONE LANE BLOCKED EXPECT DELAYS

line.name: City Terminal Zone
line.text:
City Zone Customers:

The LIRR is currently operating on a near-normal reduced weekday schedule with canceled, combined and diverted trains during the rush hours.  Regrettably, regular rush-hour service cannot resume until Amtrak, which owns and operates the East River Tunnels, completes repairs to the two tunnels that flooded during Superstorm Sandy. The tunnels were re-opened on November 12 following temporary repairs by Amtrak, but these temporary repairs do not provide the capacity necessary to accommodate all of the LIRR’s rush-hour trains. As a result, the LIRR developed and implemented a contingency train plan for the AM and PM rush hours. City Zone Customers are advised to check the LIRR’s “Schedules & Fares” webpage @ http://lirr42.mta.info/ and use the drop-down menu to select their boarding and destination stations, then the date and time of travel.  All storm-related changes have been entered into this point-to-point schedule system.

line.name: Babylon
line.text:
Babylon Branch Customers:

Due to ongoing reduced capacity in Amtrak's East River tunnels as a result of damage caused by Hurricane Sandy, the following trains will be canceled or diverted:

AM Peak Affected Babylon Trains
  • The 6:57AM train from Freeport, due Penn Station at 7:40AM, will be diverted to Atlantic Terminal. Customers for Penn Station must transfer at Jamaica.
  • The 7:26AM train from Wantagh, due Penn Station at 8:16AM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 7:10AM train from Babylon, which will make added stops at Wantagh, Bellmore, and Merrick.
  • The 7:29AM train from Freeport, due Penn Station at 8:13AM, will be canceled at Jamaica, with added stops at Freeport, Baldwin and Rockville Centre. Customers will transfer to the next available westbound train to Penn Station.
  • The 7:48AM train from Wantagh, due Penn Station at 8:40AM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 7:29AM train from Babylon due Atlantic Terminal at 8:43AM. Customers for Penn Station must transfer at Jamaica.
  • The 8:10AM train from Freeport, due Penn Station at 8:50AM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 7:45AM train from Babylon, which will make added stops at Freeport, Baldwin and Rockville Centre.
  • The 8:25AM train from Freeport, due Penn Station at 9:08AM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 8:03AM train from Babylon, which will make added stops at Baldwin and Rockville Centre.
PM Peak Affected Babylon Trains
  • The 4:34PM train from Penn Station, due Babylon at 5:39PM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 4:37PM train from Penn Station, which will stop at Jamaica, St. Albans, Lynbrook, Rockville Centre and then all local stops to Babylon.
  • The 4:52PM train from Penn Station, due Babylon at 5:55PM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 5:03PM train from Penn Station, with a stops at Rockville Centre, and then all local stops to Babylon.
  • The 5:13PM train from Penn Station, due Wantagh at 6:19PM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 5:19PM train from Penn Station, with stops at Woodside, Jamaica, Merrick, and then all local stops to Babylon.
  • The 5:24PM train from Penn Station, due Freeport at 6:10PM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 5:35PM Huntington train from Penn Station, due Jamaica at 5:55PM, for transfer to the 6:05PM Babylon train with a stop at Rockville Centre, and then all local stops to Babylon.
  • The 5:36PM train from Penn Station, due Babylon at 6:40PM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 5:40PM train from Penn Station, which will stop at Merrick, and then all local stops to Babylon.
  • The 6:03PM train from Babylon due in Penn at 7:04PM is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the next available westbound.
  • The 6:05PM train from Penn Station, due Wantagh at 6:51PM is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 6:10PM train from Penn Station, with a stop at Rockville Centre, and then all local stops to Wantagh.
  • The 6:33PM train from Penn Station, due Babylon at 7:35PM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 6:36PM train from Penn Station, with stops at Jamaica, St. Albans, Rockville Centre, and then all local stops to Babylon.

line.name: Far Rockaway
line.text:
Far Rockaway Branch Customers:

Due to ongoing reduced capacity in Amtrak's East River tunnels as a result of damage caused by Hurricane Sandy, the following trains will be canceled or diverted:

AM Peak Affected Far Rockaway Trains
  • The 7:18AM train from Far Rockaway, due Atlantic Terminal at 8:11AM, will make added stops at Rosedale and Laurelton.
  • The 7:49AM train from Far Rockaway due Penn at 8:42AM, will make added stops at Rosedale, Laurelton and Locust Manor.
  • The 8:10AM from Far Rockaway, due Penn Station at 9:05AM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 8:21AM from Far Rockaway, which will be canceled at Jamaica. Customers for Penn Station must transfer at Jamaica. The Kew Gardens and Forest Hills stops for this train will be added to a Huntington westbound train at 8:54AM and 8:56AM, respectively.
  • The 8:21AM from Far Rockaway, due Penn Station at 9:17AM, will be canceled in Jamaica. Customers for Penn Station must transfer at Jamaica.

line.name: Hempstead
line.text:
Hempstead Branch Customers:

Due to ongoing reduced capacity in Amtrak's East River tunnels as a result of damage caused by Hurricane Sandy, the following trains will be canceled or diverted:

AM Peak Affected Hempstead Trains
  • The 7:12AM from Hempstead, due Penn Station at 8:03AM, will terminate at Jamaica. Customers for Penn Station must transfer at Jamaica.
  • The 7:26AM from East Williston (7:31AM train from Mineola), due Penn Station 8:14AM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 7:29AM train from Hicksville, which will make added stops at Mineola, Merillon Ave., New Hyde Park, Floral Park, Queens Village, Hollis and Jamaica. The next train from East Williston will depart at 7:48AM.
  • The 7:38AM from Floral Park, due Penn Station at 8:14AM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 7:29AM train from Hicksville, which will make added stops at Mineola, Merillon Ave., New Hyde Park, Floral Park, Queens Village, Hollis and Jamaica.
PM Peak Affected Hempstead Train
  • The 5:04PM train from Penn Station, due Hempstead at 5:57PM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 5:06PM Huntington train from Penn Station, due Jamaica at 5:25PM, making added stops at Forest Hills and Kew Gardens, for transfer to the 5:39PM Hempstead train with a stop at Hollis, and then all local stops to Hempstead.

line.name: Long Beach
line.text:
Long Beach Branch Customers:

Due to ongoing reduced capacity in Amtrak's East River tunnels as a result of damage caused by Hurricane Sandy, the following trains will be canceled or diverted:

AM Peak Affected Long Beach Trains
  • The 6:54AM from Long Beach, due Atlantic Terminal at 7:49AM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 7:04AM from Long Beach due Penn Station at 7:57AM, with an added stop at Jamaica. Customers for Atlantic Terminal must transfer at Jamaica.
  • The 7:23AM from Long Beach, due Penn Station at 8:22AM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 7:39AM from Long Beach due Penn Station at 8:32AM.
  • The 7:56AM from Long Beach, due Atlantic Terminal at 8:51AM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 8:03AM from Long Beach due Penn Station at 8:54AM. This train will make added stops at Valley Stream and Jamaica. Customers for Atlantic Terminal must transfer at Jamaica.
  • The 8:08AM from Long Beach, due Penn Station at 9:02AM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 8:38AM from Long Beach due Atlantic Terminal at 9:26AM. Customers for Penn Station must transfer at Jamaica.
PM Peak Affected Long Beach Trains
  • The 4:40PM from Penn Station due Long Beach at 5:37PM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 5:00PM from Penn Station, due Long Beach 5:55PM.
  • Due to ongoing reduced capacity in Amtrak's East River tunnels, the 5:20PM train from Penn due Long Beach at 6:11PM is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 5:23PM train from Penn Station, due Long Beach at 6:18PM.
  • The 7:33PM from Penn Station, due Long Beach at 8:26PM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 8:12PM from Atlantic Terminal, due Long Beach at 9:03PM. Customers at Penn Station should take the 8:08PM from Penn to Babylon and transfer at Jamaica for the Long Beach train.

line.name: Montauk
line.text:
Montauk Branch Customers:

Due to ongoing reduced capacity in Amtrak's East River tunnels as a result of damage caused by Hurricane Sandy, the following train will be canceled:


AM Peak Affected Montauk Train

  • The 5:08AM from Speonk, due Penn Station at 7:02AM, will be canceled at Jamaica. Customers can take the 5:30AM train from Speonk. Customers for Penn Station must transfer at Jamaica.

line.name: Oyster Bay
line.text:
Oyster Bay Branch Customers:

Due to ongoing reduced capacity in Amtrak's East River tunnels as a result of damage caused by Hurricane Sandy, the following trains will be canceled:

AM Peak Affected Oyster Bay Train
  • The 7:26AM from East Williston (7:31AM train from Mineola), due Penn Station 8:14AM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 7:29AM train from Hicksville, which will make added stops at Mineola, Merillon Ave., New Hyde Park, Floral Park, Queens Village, Hollis and Jamaica. The next train from East Williston will depart at 7:48AM.
PM Peak Affected Oyster Bay Train
  • The 6:16PM train from Penn Station, due Oyster Bay at 7:30PM, is canceled from Penn Station and will originate at Jamaica, departing at 6:36PM. Customers will be accommodated by the 6:08PM Huntington train from Penn Station, due Jamaica at 6:28PM for transfer to the Oyster Bay train.

line.name: Port Jefferson
line.text:
Port Jefferson Branch Customers:

Due to ongoing reduced capacity in Amtrak's East River tunnels as a result of damage caused by Hurricane Sandy, the following trains will be canceled or diverted:

AM Peak Affected Port Jefferson Trains
  • The 7:26AM from East Williston (7:31AM train from Mineola), due Penn Station 8:14AM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 7:29AM train from Hicksville, which will make added stops at Mineola, Merillon Ave., New Hyde Park, Floral Park, Queens Village, Hollis and Jamaica. The next train from East Williston will depart at 7:48AM.
  • The 7:28AM from Cold Spring Harbor, due Penn Station at 8:25AM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 7:19AM from Huntington, which will operate four minutes later – departing Huntington at 7:23AM. Customers for Penn Station must transfer at Jamaica.
  • The 7:31AM train from Mineola, due Penn Station 8:14AM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 7:29AM train from Hicksville, which will make added stops at Mineola, Merillon Avenue, New Hyde Park, Floral Park, Queens Village, Hollis and Jamaica.
  • The 7:37AM train from Huntington, due Penn Station 8:37AM, will make an added stop at Jamaica.
  • The 8:04AM train from Huntington due Penn at 9:08AM will make added stops at Kew Gardens and Forest Hills.
PM Peak Affected Port Jefferson Trains
  • The 5:35PM train from Penn due Huntington at 6:34PM, will make added station stops in Forest Hills at 5:49PM, and in Kew Gardens at 5:41PM.
  • The 5:46PM train from Penn Station, due Huntington at 6:51PM, has been canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 6:08PM train from Penn Station, with stops at Woodside, Jamaica, New Hyde Park, and then all local stops to Huntington.
  • The 6:29PM train from Huntington due Penn at 7:34PM, will make added station stops at Merillon Avenue and New Hyde Park.
  • The 7:05PM train from Huntington due Penn Station at 8:09PM is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the next westbound.

line.name: Port Washington
line.text:
Port Washington Branch Customers:

Due to ongoing reduced capacity in Amtrak's East River tunnels as a result of damage caused by Hurricane Sandy, the following trains will be canceled or diverted:

PM Peak Affected Port Washington Trains
  • The 4:22PM train from Penn Station, due Port Washington at 4:58PM, has been canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 4:25PM train from Penn Station, making all local stops to Port Washington.
  • The 4:43PM train from Penn Station, due Port Washington at 5:21PM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 4:46PM train from Penn Station, which will make all local stops to Port Washington.
  • The 5:11PM train from Penn Station, due Port Washington at 5:47PM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 5:14PM train from Penn Station, with a stop at Bayside and then all local stops to Port Washington.
  • The 5:26PM train from Penn Station, due Port Washington at 6:04PM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 5:29PM train from Penn Station, with a stop at Woodside and then all local stops to Port Washington.
  • The 5:44PM train from Great Neck due in Penn at 6:17PM is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the next available westbound.
  • The 5:50PM train from Penn Station, due Great Neck at 6:19PM is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 5:56PM train from Penn Station with a stop at Woodside, and then all stops to Great Neck.
  • The 6:23PM train from Great Neck due in Penn at 6:58PM is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the next available westbound.
  • The 6:44PM train from Great Neck due in Penn at 7:15PM is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the next available westbound.

line.name: Ronkonkoma
line.text:
Ronkonkoma Branch Customers:

  • There are delays of up to 15 minutes in both directions east of Farmingdale due to ongoing signal problems.

Due to ongoing reduced capacity in Amtrak's East River tunnels as a result of damage caused by Hurricane Sandy, the following trains will be canceled or diverted:

AM Peak Affected Ronkonkoma Trains

  • The 6:54AM train from Central Islip, due Penn Station at 8:06AM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 6:56AM train from Ronkonkoma.
  • The 7:31AM train from Mineola, due Penn Station 8:14AM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 7:29AM train from Hicksville, which will make added stops at Mineola, Merillon Avenue, New Hyde Park, Floral Park, Queens Village, Hollis and Jamaica.
PM Peak Affected Ronkonkoma Trains
  • The 4:54PM train from Penn Station, due Farmingdale at 5:56PM, is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the 5:01PM train from Penn Station, with stops at Woodside, Jamaica, New Hyde Park, and then all local stops to Ronkonkoma.
  • The 6:25PM train from Farmingdale due in Penn at 7:22PM is canceled. Customers will be accommodated by the next available westbound.
  • The 7:13PM train from Ronkonkoma will make added station stops at Merillon Avenue and New Hyde Park.

line.name: West Hempstead
line.text:
West Hempstead Branch Customers:

The LIRR is currently operating on a near-normal reduced weekday schedule with canceled, combined and diverted trains during the rush hours.  Regrettably, regular rush-hour service cannot resume until Amtrak, which owns and operates the East River Tunnels, completes repairs to the two tunnels that flooded during Superstorm Sandy. The tunnels were re-opened on November 12 following temporary repairs by Amtrak, but these temporary repairs do not provide the capacity necessary to accommodate all of the LIRR’s rush-hour trains. As a result, the LIRR developed and implemented a contingency train plan for the AM and PM rush hours.  West Hempstead customers are advised check the LIRR’s “Schedules & Fares” webpage @ http://lirr42.mta.info/ and use the drop-down menu to select their boarding and destination stations, then the date and time of travel.  All storm-related changes have been entered into this point-to-point schedule system.

line.name: Pascack Valley
line.text: Most regular weekday service resumes on the Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Lines beginning on Monday, Nov. 19. See www.njtransit.com for all train times.

line.name: Port Jervis
line.text: Most regular weekday service resumes on the Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Lines beginning on Monday, Nov. 19. See www.njtransit.com for all train times.
